content.question:
Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight.

Two toy cars, <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, are placed on parallel tracks as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. At time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> both cars are released from rest from position <math alttext="x equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>. Car <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> moves with constant acceleration of magnitude <math alttext="a sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math> in the <math alttext="positive x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></math>-direction and Car <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> moves with constant acceleration of magnitude <math alttext="the fraction a sub 0, end sub, over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mstyle></math> in the <math alttext="negative x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>-</mo><mi>x</mi></math>-direction.

(a) Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> shows the position of Car <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> at times <math alttext="t equals 1 second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="t equals 2 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="t equals 3 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="t equals 4 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>. Draw corresponding dots to represent the position of Car <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> at times <math alttext="t equals 1 second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="t equals 2 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="t equals 3 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="t equals 4 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>.

frqParts.text:
Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight.

Two toy cars, <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, are placed on parallel tracks as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. At time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> both cars are released from rest from position <math alttext="x equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>. Car <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> moves with constant acceleration of magnitude <math alttext="a sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math> in the <math alttext="positive x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></math>-direction and Car <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> moves with constant acceleration of magnitude <math alttext="the fraction a sub 0, end sub, over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mstyle></math> in the <math alttext="negative x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>-</mo><mi>x</mi></math>-direction.

(a) Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> shows the position of Car <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> at times <math alttext="t equals 1 second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="t equals 2 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="t equals 3 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="t equals 4 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>. Draw corresponding dots to represent the position of Car <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> at times <math alttext="t equals 1 second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="t equals 2 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="t equals 3 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="t equals 4 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>.

(b) Starting with an appropriate kinematic equation, derive an expression for the distance between the two cars after time <math alttext="t sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math> in terms of <math alttext="a sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math>.

(c) Sketch and label a graph of the velocity of each car as a function of time between times <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="t equals t sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math>.

(d) At time <math alttext="t equals t sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math> the cars <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> have traveled distances <math alttext="d sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>d</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="d sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>d</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>, respectively. Indicate whether <math alttext="d sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>d</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> is greater than, less than or equal to <math alttext="d sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>d</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="d sub A is greater than d sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>d</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>d</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> __________          <math alttext="d sub A is less than d sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>d</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>d</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> __________           <math alttext="d sub A equals d sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>d</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>d</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> __________

Justify your claim by using evidence from the graph sketched in part (c).

skill.text: 1.A: Create diagrams, tables, charts, or schematics to represent physical situations.
